cards.name: Aether Shockwave
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Tap all Spirits.
• Tap all non-Spirit creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The strain upon the veil between worlds began to show near the end of the Kami War. Strange happenings that neither side could control lashed out across Kamigawa."
—Observations of the Kami War

rulings.text: You choose the mode on announcement.

cards.originalText: Choose one Tap all Spirits; or tap all non-Spirit creatures.

cards.name: Araba Mothrider
cards.text:
Flying
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"My finest creations are fashioned after the moths of Eiganjo. They fly higher, faster, and more gracefully than any of my own designs."
—Noboru, master kitemaker
cards.originalText:
Flying
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Celestial Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: All bow at its visitation—some in awe, some in honor, some in fear.

rulings.text: If the Spirit or Arcane spell has {X} in the mana cost, then you use the value of {X} on the stack. For example, Shining Shoal costs {X}{W}{W}. If you choose X = 2, then Shining Shoal's converted mana cost is 4. Shining Shoal also has an ability that says "You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost"; if you choose to pay the alternative cost and exile a card with converted mana cost 2, then X is 2 while Shining Shoal is on the stack and its converted mana cost is 4.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, destroy all permanents with that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Charge Across the Araba
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.
cards.originalText: Sweep Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.

cards.name: Cowed by Wisdom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand. (This cost is paid as attackers or blockers are declared.)

cards.name: Curtain of Light
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Paint gold upon the wind,
Shape the wind into a shield,
And vanish behind the brightness."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

rulings.text: An attacking unblocked creature exists from the time the defending player chooses not to block that creature until the combat phase ends. Curtain of Light doesn't have any legal targets outside of the combat phase.
Curtain of Light does trigger bushido abilities.

Curtain of Light isn't particularly effective against creatures with trample. Since the creature with trample has no blocker to assign damage to, all the damage will be assigned to the defending player.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Target attacking unblocked creature becomes blocked.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Descendant of Kiyomaro
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Descendant of Kiyomaro gets +1/+2 and has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain 3 life."
cards.flavor: "The blood of Kiyomaro flows in my veins. He did not let Eiganjo fall and neither shall I."

rulings.text: If any opponent has more cards or as many cards in hand as Descendant of Kiyomaro's controller, Descendant of Kiyomaro doesn't get any bonus.
Changing the number of cards in any player's hand can cause Descendant of Kiyomaro to lose the life-gain triggered ability. Once an ability triggers, however, it exists independently of its source.

cards.originalText: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Descendant of Kiyomaro gets +1/+2 and has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain 3 life."

cards.name: Eiganjo Free-Riders
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a white creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The air filled with dust and the sound of wingbeats. The mothriders had joined the fray."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a white creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Enduring Ideal
cards.text:
Search your library for an enchantment card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability.)
cards.originalText:
Search your library for an enchantment card and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't play spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability.)

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Redeemer
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.
Channel — {1}{W}, Discard Ghost-Lit Redeemer: You gain 4 life.
cards.originalText:
{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.
Channel {1}{W}, Discard Ghost-Lit Redeemer: You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Hail of Arrows
cards.text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

rulings.text: You choose how the damage will be divided among the target creatures at the time you cast Hail of Arrows. Each target must be dealt at least 1 damage. If any of those creatures becomes an illegal target before Hail of Arrows resolves, the division of damage among the remaining creatures doesn't change.

cards.originalText: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.

cards.name: Hand of Honor
cards.text:
Protection from black
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that brings it to life."
cards.originalText:
Protection from black
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Inner-Chamber Guard
cards.text: Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"It seems that each time I visit Lord Konda his guards are more on edge, perhaps even more eager for the war to reach them."
—Masako the Humorless
cards.originalText: Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Kataki, War's Wage
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."
cards.flavor:
"Before the war, we prayed to Kataki to sharpen our swords and harden our armor. Without his blessing our weapons are all but useless against the kami hordes."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

foreignNames.name: Kataki, el precio de la guerra

cards.originalText: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {1}."

cards.name: Kitsune Bonesetter
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Activate this ability only if you have more cards in hand than each opponent.
cards.flavor:
"He kept generations whole before the Kami War, and now he turns his century of wisdom to healing the latest casualties."
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Play this ability only if you have more cards in hand than each opponent.

cards.name: Kitsune Dawnblade
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Kitsune Dawnblade enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.
cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Kitsune Dawnblade comes into play, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Kitsune Loreweaver
cards.text: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Know your history. The lessons of the past will shield you in times of doubt."
cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Kitsune Loreweaver gets +0/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Kiyomaro, First to Stand
cards.text:
Kiyomaro, First to Stand's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
As long as you have four or more cards in hand, Kiyomaro has vigilance.
Whenever Kiyomaro deals damage, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 7 life.

rulings.text: Kiyomaro's power and toughness don't affect whether it has vigilance or the life-gain ability.
Losing vigilance after attackers are declared doesn't cause Kiyomaro to tap.
If you have seven or more cards in hand when Kiyomaro's triggered ability goes on the stack but less than seven when the ability resolves, the ability does nothing.

foreignNames.name: 初めて立ったもの、清麻呂

cards.originalText:
Kiyomaro, First to Stand's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
As long as you have four or more cards in hand, Kiyomaro has vigilance.
Whenever Kiyomaro deals damage, if you have seven or more cards in hand, you gain 7 life.

cards.name: Michiko Konda, Truth Seeker
cards.text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, that player sacrifices a permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Watch over my father. Tell him I'm safe, but I won't come home until I find out how to bring him back to his senses, and Kamigawa is again at peace."
—Michiko Konda, last letter to General Takeno

rulings.text: One permanent is sacrificed each time an opponent's source deals damage to Michiko Konda's controller. The amount of damage doesn't matter.
Sources that deal damage multiple times (such as creatures with double strike) will trigger Michiko Konda multiple times.

Spells that deal damage repeatedly trigger Michiko Konda's ability each time they deal damage. For example, a Glacial Ray spliced onto another Glacial Ray triggers the ability twice (once for each "2 damage" event from the Glacial Ray).

foreignNames.name: 真実を求める者、今田魅知子

cards.originalText: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, that player sacrifices a permanent.

cards.name: Moonwing Moth
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Moonwing Moth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Night wings sprinkled with dust
Of a thousand soldiers dead
And a thousand cities fallen."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet
cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Moonwing Moth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nikko-Onna
cards.text:
When Nikko-Onna enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Nikko-Onna to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
When Nikko-Onna comes into play, destroy target enchantment.
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Nikko-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Plow Through Reito
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.
cards.flavor: The paths of the kami crisscrossed Kamigawa like scars left by a maddened surgeon.
cards.originalText: Sweep Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.

cards.name: Presence of the Wise
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: "Humbly I bow. Silently I wait. Deeply I listen."
cards.originalText: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Promise of Bunrei
cards.text: When a creature you control dies, sacrifice Promise of Bunrei. If you do, create four 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "I am not afraid to die today nor afraid of what death will bring."

rulings.text: Promise of Bunrei's ability will trigger multiple times if multiple creatures die at once, but it will only be sacrificed once. You'll get only four Spirit tokens.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, sacrifice Promise of Bunrei. If you do, put four 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Pure Intentions
cards.text:
Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard cards this turn, return those cards from your graveyard to your hand.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Pure Intentions, return Pure Intentions from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The first part of Pure Intentions is the effect of casting Pure Intentions. The second part is a triggered ability that triggers whenever an opponent's spell or ability causes a player to discard Pure Intentions.
Neither part cares who decides which card to discard — only the controller of the spell or ability matters.
Discarding Pure Intentions to your own spell or ability doesn't trigger its abilities.

If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a player to discard multiple cards, such as Waking Nightmare or Three Tragedies, Pure Intentions doesn't return to hand until its triggered ability has resolved. A player can't discard the same Pure Intentions twice for the same discard effect.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard cards this turn, return those cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Pure Intentions, return Pure Intentions from your graveyard to your hand at end of turn.

cards.name: Reverence
cards.text: Creatures with power 2 or less can't attack you.
cards.flavor:
"Despite the massive forces that allied against him, Konda never once believed he would lose the Kami War."
—Masako the Humorless

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText: Creatures with power 2 or less can't attack you.

cards.name: Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant
cards.text: When you have 30 or more life, flip Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant.

rulings.text: Each Ascendant is legendary in both its unflipped and flipped forms. This means that effects that look for legendary creature cards, such as Time of Need and Captain Sisay, can find an Ascendant.

cards.originalText: When you have 30 or more life, flip Rune-Tail, Kitsune Ascendant.

cards.name: Rune-Tail's Essence
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures you control.

cards.name: Shinen of Stars' Light
cards.text:
First strike
Channel — {1}{W}, Discard Shinen of Stars' Light: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Channel {1}{W}, Discard Shinen of Stars' Light: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Spiritual Visit
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token.
Splice onto Arcane {W} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token into play.
Splice onto Arcane {W} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Torii Watchward
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Soulshift 4 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Cloudhoof Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may have target player put the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the Spirit or Arcane spell has {X} in the mana cost, then you use the value of {X} on the stack. For example, Shining Shoal costs {X}{W}{W}. If you choose X = 2, then Shining Shoal's converted mana cost is 4. Shining Shoal also has an ability that says "You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost"; if you choose to pay the alternative cost and exile a card with converted mana cost 2, then X is 2 while Shining Shoal is on the stack and its converted mana cost is 4.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put the top X cards of target player's library into his or her graveyard, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Cut the Earthly Bond
cards.text: Return target enchanted permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"The more kami that passed through the veil that separated them from our world, the weaker that veil became, threatening to tear into tatters at the slightest pressure."
—The History of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: Return target enchanted permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Descendant of Soramaro
cards.text: {1}{U}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of cards in your hand, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: "Soramaro speaks through me. Listen! And I will tell the wisdom of the ancestors."
cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of cards in your hand, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Dreamcatcher
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may sacrifice Dreamcatcher. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful where your mind wanders. Even in the quietest moments, the kami are listening, and your thoughts give them shape."
—Lady Azami
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may sacrifice Dreamcatcher. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Erayo, Soratami Ascendant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever the fourth spell of a turn is cast, flip Erayo, Soratami Ascendant.

rulings.text: Erayo's Essence triggers only for the first spell an opponent casts in a given turn. It doesn't trigger off any other spell that player casts after the first.

If Erayo, Soratami Ascendant flips while an opponent's first spell for the turn is still on the stack, the ability of Erayo's Essence doesn't trigger because the opponent's spell has already been cast. The spell isn't countered.
If you have multiple opponents, Erayo's Essence can trigger once for each opponent.
Each Ascendant is legendary in both its unflipped and flipped forms. This means that effects that look for legendary creature cards, such as Time of Need and Captain Sisay, can find an Ascendant.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever the fourth spell of a turn is played, flip Erayo, Soratami Ascendant.

cards.name: Erayo's Essence
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts their first spell each turn, counter that spell.
cards.originalText: Counter the first spell played by each opponent each turn.

cards.name: Eternal Dominion
cards.text:
Search target opponent's library for an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles their library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)
cards.originalText:
Search target opponent's library for an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card. Put that card into play under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't play spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

cards.name: Evermind
cards.text:
(Nonexistent mana costs can't be paid.)
Draw a card.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: Evermind is blue in all zones.

Evermind is a blue Arcane instant card. Cards that check whether a card has any of those attributes will affect Evermind. For example, you can exile it (as a blue card) to pay the alternative costs of spells like Force of Will and Disrupting Shoal (X = 0). You could search for it with Mystical Tutor because it's an instant or Eerie Procession because it's an Arcane spell.
If a spell or effect, such as Parallectric Feedback, asks for Evermind's converted mana cost, it's 0.
Evermind has no mana cost, which means it can't normally be cast as a spell. You could, however, cast it via some alternate means, like with Sunforger or Kaho, Minamo Historian.
You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

Although originally printed with a characteristic-defining ability that defined its color, this card now has a color indicator. This color indicator can't be affected by text-changing effects (such as the one created by Crystal Spray), although color-changing effects can still overwrite it.
This has no mana cost, which means its mana cost can't be paid for effects such as replicate from Djinn Illuminatus or flashback from Snapcaster Mage.

cards.originalText:
(Spells without mana costs can't be played.)
Draw a card.
Evermind is blue.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{U} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Freed from the Real
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Tap enchanted creature.
{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: When a strong mind moves, form and energy shift to heed it.

rulings.text: Only the player who controls Freed from the Real can activate its abilities. This might not be the controller of the enchanted creature.

cards.originalText:
{U}: Tap enchanted creature.
{U}: Untap enchanted creature.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Warder
cards.text:
{3}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Channel — {3}{U}, Discard Ghost-Lit Warder: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.
cards.originalText:
{3}{U}, {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Channel {3}{U}, Discard Ghost-Lit Warder: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {4}.

cards.name: Ideas Unbound
cards.text: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The apprentice stared in puzzlement. "But Master, you finished writing those spells just yesterday. Don't you remember?" The jushi's heart froze.

rulings.text: If you don't have three or more cards in hand at the end of turn, you discard what cards you have.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards. Discard three cards at end of turn.

cards.name: Kaho, Minamo Historian
cards.text:
When Kaho, Minamo Historian enters the battlefield, search your library for up to three instant cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
{X}, {T}: You may cast a card with converted mana cost X exiled with Kaho without paying its mana cost.

rulings.text: If an effect takes a card Kaho exiled out of the Exile zone, then you can't use Kaho's ability to cast that card.
If another player gains control of Kaho, that player may cast any of the cards exiled with Kaho's ability.
Kaho's activated ability refers only to cards exiled by its triggered ability. If another effect exiled the cards, you won't be able to use Kaho to cast those cards.

cards.originalText:
When Kaho, Minamo Historian comes into play, search your library for up to three instant cards and remove them from the game. Then shuffle your library.
{X}, {T}: You may play a card with converted mana cost X removed from the game with Kaho without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Kami of the Crescent Moon
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor:
"He's a lot like me, that masterless little kami . . . unimpressed by grandeur and never at a loss for a trick."
—Toshiro Umezawa

rulings.text: The additional draw triggers just after the normal draw for the turn happens.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Kiri-Onna
cards.text:
When Kiri-Onna enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kiri-Onna to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield as Kiri-Onna enters the battlefield, you must target Kiri-Onna with its own ability.

cards.originalText:
When Kiri-Onna comes into play, return target creature to its owner's hand.
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kiri-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Meishin, the Mind Cage
cards.text: All creatures get -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: It's dangerous indeed to be lost in someone else's thoughts.
cards.originalText: All creatures get -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.
cards.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Minamo Scrollkeeper onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be three. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.

cards.name: Moonbow Illusionist
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only the targeted land is affected.
The land's name as well as any supertype it might have (such as legendary) remains unchanged.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target land's type becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Murmurs from Beyond
cards.text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. An opponent chooses one of them. Put that card into your graveyard and the rest into your hand.
cards.flavor: Like pools of fog that hid treacherous rocks from sailors' eyes, so too were the hands of the kami.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top three cards of your library. An opponent chooses one. Put that card into your graveyard and the rest into your hand.

cards.name: Oboro Breezecaller
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Untap target land.
cards.flavor:
"I feel their unnatural influence in the weary, weeping land. Do they care nothing for the creatures who walk below their clouds?"
—Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Untap target land.

cards.name: Oboro Envoy
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

rulings.text: The errata makes the ability temporary. As printed, the effect didn't end.
The X will usually include the land returned to pay the ability's cost.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature gets -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Oppressive Will
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: When Minamo was abandoned, its younger students found themselves thrust into a war beyond their skill with talents beyond their control.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Overwhelming Intellect
cards.text: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "My brain hurts."
cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Rushing-Tide Zubera
cards.text: When Rushing-Tide Zubera dies, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, draw three cards.
cards.flavor: Cut off from the kakuriyo by the destruction of their honden, the zubera sought new ways to bring their secrets home.

rulings.text: Rushing-Tide Zubera's ability counts all damage dealt to it this turn, from all sources.

cards.originalText: When Rushing-Tide Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, if 4 or more damage was dealt to it this turn, draw three cards.

cards.name: Sakashima the Impostor
cards.text: You may have Sakashima the Impostor enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except its name is Sakashima the Impostor, it's legendary in addition to its other types, and it has "{2}{U}{U}: Return this creature to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step."

rulings.text: If there is no creature on the battlefield or if you don't choose a creature as Sakashima enters the battlefield, Sakashima remains a 3/1 Human Rogue.

Sakashima doesn't get the return to hand ability unless a creature is copied as Sakashima enters the battlefield. Sakashima can't copy itself because the choice is made as part of the event that puts it onto the battlefield, and whatever will be copied must already be on the battlefield.

Sakashima must be on the battlefield at the end of turn in order to return to hand. If Sakashima leaves the battlefield after the ability is activated but before the at-end-of-turn ability resolves, the ability does nothing.

cards.originalText: As Sakashima the Impostor comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Sakashima comes into play as a copy of that creature, except its name is still Sakashima the Impostor, it's still legendary, and it gains "{2}{U}{U}: Return Sakashima the Impostor to its owner's hand at end of turn."

cards.name: Secretkeeper
cards.text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Secretkeeper gets +2/+2 and has flying.
cards.flavor: It is all the things that humanity was not meant to know.
cards.originalText: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Secretkeeper gets +2/+2 and has flying.

cards.name: Shape Stealer
cards.text: Whenever Shape Stealer blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, change Shape Stealer's base power and toughness to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Stand back. I know just what to do."
—Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker

rulings.text: This ability triggers once for each creature blocked by or blocking Shape Stealer. If multiple creatures block it, Shape Stealer's power and toughness will change for each one in succession. The first trigger put on the stack will be the last to resolve, so that will set Shape Stealer's final power and toughness.
The other creature's power and toughness are determined as the triggered ability resolves.

If the other creature has bushido, whether Shape Stealer gets the bushido bonus depends on whose turn it is. If Shape Stealer is blocking, it won't get the attacker's bushido bonus. If the Shape Stealer is being blocked, the bushido ability will resolve just before Shape Stealer determines what the creature's power and toughness are.
If Shape Stealer's new toughness is less than any damage on Shape Stealer, Shape Stealer will be destroyed as a state-based action once the triggered ability resolves.
Once the ability resolves, changing the other creature's power or toughness doesn't affect Shape Stealer.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: Whenever Shape Stealer blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, change Shape Stealer's power and toughness to that creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Shifting Borders
cards.text:
Exchange control of two target lands.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: If one of the targeted lands isn't a legal target as Shifting Borders resolves (say, because it has left the battlefield or become untargetable), the exchange doesn't occur.
You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Exchange control of two target lands.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{U} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Shinen of Flight's Wings
cards.text:
Flying
Channel — {U}, Discard Shinen of Flight's Wings: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Shinen de las alas del vuelo

cards.originalText:
Flying
Channel {U}, Discard Shinen of Flight's Wings: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.text:
Flying
Soramaro, First to Dream's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{4}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card.

foreignNames.name: 初めて夢見たもの、空麻呂

cards.originalText:
Flying
Soramaro, First to Dream's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{4}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card.

cards.name: Trusted Advisor
cards.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by two.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Some of Minamo's students claimed he was as old as the knowledge he dispensed.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Trusted Advisor onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
Your maximum hand size is increased by two.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a blue creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Twincast
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you have to search for inspiration, and sometimes it's right there in front of you.

rulings.text: You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.
Twincast copies any text spliced onto the targeted spell, but you can't splice additional text onto the copy.
Twincast can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn't matter who controls it.

As Twincast resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. That copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Twincast copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell Twincast copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

If the copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Akuta, Born of Ash
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may sacrifice a Swamp. If you do, return Akuta, Born of Ash from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: Akuta must already be in your graveyard as your upkeep begins in order for its ability to trigger.
In multiplayer games, it checks for each opponent.

cards.originalText:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may sacrifice a Swamp. If you do, return Akuta, Born of Ash from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Choice of Damnations
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a number. You may have that player lose that much life. If you don't, that player sacrifices all but that many permanents.
cards.flavor:
"Life is a series of choices between bad and worse."
—Toshiro Umezawa

rulings.text: After the opponent chooses a number, Choice of Damnations' controller may choose to make that opponent either lose that much life or make that opponent sacrifice permanents.

If the opponent must sacrifice all but a number of permanents, that opponent chooses that many permanents and then sacrifices the rest. If the number chosen is greater than the number of permanents the opponent controls, the player sacrifices nothing.

cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses a number. You may have that player lose that much life. If you don't, that player sacrifices all but that many permanents.

cards.name: Death Denied
cards.text: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Takenuma was filled with a chorus of moans, shrieks, and wails. Some came from the living, some from the dying, and some, most horribly, from the dead.
cards.originalText: Return X target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Death of a Thousand Stings
cards.text:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Death of a Thousand Stings from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Death of a Thousand Stings from your graveyard to your hand.

Flying

Soulshift 1 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Deathmask Nezumi
cards.text: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Deathmask Nezumi gets +2/+1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"We had him cornered, we did . . . and, well, you know what they say about rats."
—Araba patrol survivor
cards.originalText: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Deathmask Nezumi gets +2/+1 and has fear.

cards.name: Exile into Darkness
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Exile into Darkness from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Target player sacrifices a creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have more cards in hand than each opponent, you may return Exile into Darkness from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Footsteps of the Goryo
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: In the case of violent deaths, kami offered a chance for revenge if the deceased offered up its corpse as a host to the invading kami.
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. Sacrifice that creature at end of turn.

cards.name: Ghost-Lit Stalker
cards.text:
{4}{B}, {T}: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
Channel — {5}{B}{B}, Discard Ghost-Lit Stalker: Target player discards four cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText:
{4}{B}, {T}: Target player discards two cards. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.
Channel {5}{B}{B}, Discard Ghost-Lit Stalker: Target player discards four cards. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Gnat Miser
cards.text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one.
cards.flavor: Nezumi insect-shamans enjoyed solitary lives, which was fortunate since no other nezumi could stand to live within half a mile of their foul stench.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify a player's hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a chosen player's maximum hand size to four) onto the battlefield choosing your opponent and then put Gnat Miser onto the battlefield, your opponent will have a maximum hand size of three. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your opponent's maximum hand size would be four.

cards.originalText: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one.

cards.name: Hand of Cruelty
cards.text:
Protection from white
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that delivers death."
cards.originalText:
Protection from white
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Infernal Kirin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target player reveals their hand and discards all cards with that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The kirin bellowed—an echoing, twisted parody of its once-inspirational call.

rulings.text: If the Spirit or Arcane spell has {X} in the mana cost, then you use the value of {X} on the stack. For example, Shining Shoal costs {X}{W}{W}. If you choose X = 2, then Shining Shoal's converted mana cost is 4. Shining Shoal also has an ability that says "You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost"; if you choose to pay the alternative cost and exile a card with converted mana cost 2, then X is 2 while Shining Shoal is on the stack and its converted mana cost is 4.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Kagemaro, First to Suffer
cards.text:
Kagemaro, First to Suffer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
{B}, Sacrifice Kagemaro: All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

rulings.text: The value of X is determined as the ability resolves.

Kagemaro, First to Suffer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

Enchant creature

cards.flavor: The mist was thick, cloying, and constricting. Shiro fought his way to fresh air only to look back and see his comrades fallen on the battlefield behind him.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

When Kemuri-Onna enters the battlefield, target player discards a card.
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kemuri-Onna to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
When Kemuri-Onna comes into play, target player discards a card.
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may return Kemuri-Onna to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Kiku's Shadow
cards.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"Me? No, I'm not going to kill you. I won't even lay a finger on you. I promise."
—Kiku, Night's Flower
cards.originalText: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

cards.name: Kuon, Ogre Ascendant
cards.text: At the beginning of the end step, if three or more creatures died this turn, flip Kuon, Ogre Ascendant.

rulings.text: Kuon's flip ability looks at everything that happened during that turn, even before Kuon entered the battlefield.
Creatures put into graveyards after the end-of-turn step begins have no particular effect on Kuon.
Each Ascendant is legendary in both its unflipped and flipped forms. This means that effects that look for legendary creature cards, such as Time of Need and Captain Sisay, can find an Ascendant.

cards.originalText: At end of turn, if three or more creatures were put into graveyards from play this turn, flip Kuon, Ogre Ascendant.

cards.name: Kuon's Essence
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Kuro's Taken
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Kuro's Taken.
cards.flavor: Simple bargains are the most tempting, and oni bargains are the simplest of all: eternal life for eternal service.
cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Kuro's Taken.

cards.name: Locust Miser
cards.text: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by two.
cards.flavor: "They're numerous, attack in swarms, and are always hungry. No wonder we rats hold such a kinship with them."

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify a player's hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Cursed Rack (an artifact that sets a chosen player's maximum hand size to four) onto the battlefield choosing your opponent and then put Locust Miser onto the battlefield, your opponent will have a maximum hand size of two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your opponent's maximum hand size would be four.

cards.originalText: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by two.

Maga, Traitor to Mortals comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Measure of Wickedness
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice Measure of Wickedness and you lose 8 life.
Whenever another card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, target opponent gains control of Measure of Wickedness.

rulings.text: Once the at-end-of-turn ability triggers, it affects the player who controlled Measure of Wickedness at that time. If Measure of Wickedness is under a different player's control as its at-end-of-turn ability resolves, however, Measure of Wickedness stays on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
At the end of your turn, sacrifice Measure of Wickedness and you lose 8 life.
Whenever another card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, target opponent gains control of Measure of Wickedness.

cards.name: Neverending Torment
cards.text:
Search target player's library for X cards, where X is the number of cards in your hand, and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't cast spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)
cards.originalText:
Search target player's library for X cards, where X is the number of cards in your hand, and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Epic (For the rest of the game, you can't play spells. At the beginning of each of your upkeeps, copy this spell except for its epic ability. You may choose a new target for the copy.)

cards.name: One with Nothing
cards.text: Discard your hand.
cards.flavor: When nothing remains, everything is equally possible.

cards.name: Pain's Reward
cards.text: Each player may bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of any number. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and draws four cards.

rulings.text: Bidding continues until all players except the one with the current high bid have declined to top that bid.
A player may bid more life than they have.

cards.originalText: You bid any amount of life. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and draws four cards.

cards.flavor:
"I lost my hounds in the war and thus found myself employing akki as servants. I found their training to be remarkably similar."
—Kensuke, houndmaster
cards.originalText: As long as you have seven or more cards in hand, Akki Underling gets +2/+1 and has first strike.

cards.name: Barrel Down Sokenzan
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Mountains you control to their owner's hand. Barrel Down Sokenzan deals damage to target creature equal to twice the number of Mountains returned this way.

rulings.text: The lands are returned on resolution; this is not a cost of casting the spell.

cards.originalText: Sweep Return any number of Mountains you control to their owner's hand. Barrel Down Sokenzan deals damage to target creature equal to twice the number of Mountains returned this way.
